title: The Life of Henry the Eighth
location: A room in the palace, London, England
scene_summary: Buckingham, Norfolk, and Abergavenny discuss Cardinal Wolsey's lavish banquet for French envoys, suspecting his ambition. They learn Wolsey arrested Buckingham's surveyor, plotting his downfall. Buckingham, angered, vows to confront Wolsey, but Norfolk warns of his power, establishing Wolsey's dominance and Buckingham's peril.

title: The Life of Henry the Eighth
location: The council chamber in the palace, London, England
scene_summary: Henry VIII thanks Wolsey for thwarting French aggression. Katherine of Aragon, Henry's queen, pleads for tax relief for the commons, blaming Wolsey's policies. Henry orders the taxes repealed. Wolsey manipulates Buckingham's surveyor to accuse him of treason, and Henry, swayed, orders Buckingham's arrest, highlighting Wolsey's influence and Katherine's compassion.

title: The Life of Henry the Eighth
location: An antechamber in the palace, London, England
scene_summary: Lord Chamberlain, Sands, and Lovell mock French fashion trends, planning a feast. They jest about courtly excess, providing comic relief and contrasting the serious political plotting, while foreshadowing Wolsey's banquet.

title: The Life of Henry the Eighth
location: A hall in York Place, Wolsey's residence, London, England
scene_summary: Wolsey hosts a lavish banquet, attended by Henry (disguised), Anne Bullen, and nobles. Henry dances with Anne, charmed by her beauty, sparking their attraction. Wolsey recognizes Henry, and the festivities continue, hinting at Henry's future interest in Anne and Wolsey's opulence.

title: The Life of Henry the Eighth
scene_summary: Two gentlemen discuss Buckingham's trial and conviction for treason, orchestrated by Wolsey. Buckingham, led to execution, forgives his accusers, lamenting his fall but accepting his fate. The gentlemen note public sympathy, reflecting Wolsey's growing unpopularity.

title: The Life of Henry the Eighth
location: An antechamber in the palace, London, England
scene_summary: Norfolk, Suffolk, and Chamberlain plot against Wolsey, resenting his control. Henry, troubled by his marriage to Katherine (his brother's widow), questions its legitimacy, influenced by Wolsey's suggestion of a French match. Wolsey and Campeius, a papal envoy, plan to annul the marriage, advancing Henry's divorce and Wolsey's schemes.

title: The Life of Henry the Eighth
location: An antechamber in the palace, London, England
scene_summary: Anne Bullen pities Katherine's plight but denies ambition. An Old Lady teases Anne about her potential queenship, hinting at Henry's interest. Lord Chamberlain announces Henry's favor, granting Anne a title and income, foreshadowing her rise and Katherine's fall.

title: The Life of Henry the Eighth
location: A hall in Blackfriars, London, England
scene_summary: At Katherine's divorce trial, she passionately defends her marriage, accusing Wolsey of bias. She appeals to Henry and exits when denied justice. Henry praises Katherine but insists on annulment, supported by Wolsey and Campeius. The trial is adjourned, frustrating Henry, highlighting Katherine's dignity and Wolsey's manipulation.

title: The Life of Henry the Eighth
scene_summary: Katherine, visited by Wolsey and Campeius, resists their pressure to accept the divorce, asserting her loyalty to Henry. They urge her to trust Henry's judgment, but she refuses, suspecting their motives, showcasing her defiance and isolation.

title: The Life of Henry the Eighth
location: An antechamber in the palace, London, England
scene_summary: Norfolk, Suffolk, and Surrey plot Wolsey's downfall, revealing his intercepted letters to the Pope opposing Henry's divorce. Henry confronts Wolsey, exposing his wealth and ambition, and dismisses him. Wolsey, alone, laments his fall, realizing his errors, as his enemies seize his power, marking his decline.

title: The Life of Henry the Eighth
location: A street in Westminster, London, England
scene_summary: Two gentlemen witness Anne's coronation procession, describing its splendor. They note Katherine's demotion to Dowager Princess and Wolsey's disgrace, while Cranmer rises in Henry's favor, reflecting the shifting court dynamics and Anne's ascendancy.

title: The Life of Henry the Eighth
scene_summary: Katherine, dying, learns of Wolsey's death and forgives him. In a vision, spirits crown her with garlands, symbolizing her sanctity. She instructs her usher, Griffith, to arrange her funeral and commends her daughter, Mary, to Henry. Katherine dies peacefully, ending her arc with grace and spiritual triumph.

title: The Life of Henry the Eighth
location: A gallery in the palace, London, England
scene_summary: Gardiner plots against Cranmer, Henry's new favorite, but Henry protects him. Suffolk informs Henry of Anne's labor, and he prays for her safety. An Old Lady announces the birth of Princess Elizabeth, delighting Henry, foreshadowing her future greatness.

title: The Life of Henry the Eighth
location: Before the council chamber, London, England
scene_summary: Cranmer, summoned by the council, is kept waiting, targeted by Gardiner. Henry, observing, ensures Cranmer's defense, giving him a ring to signal royal favor, protecting him from political enemies and affirming Henry's authority.

title: The Life of Henry the Eighth
scene_summary: Gardiner and the council accuse Cranmer of heresy, planning his arrest. Cranmer produces Henry's ring, humbling his accusers. Henry enters, rebuking Gardiner and affirming Cranmer's loyalty, securing his position and demonstrating royal control.

title: The Life of Henry the Eighth
scene_summary: A Porter and his Man struggle to control a crowd celebrating Princess Elizabeth's christening. They jest about the public's fervor, providing comic relief and emphasizing the national joy at the royal birth.

title: The Life of Henry the Eighth
scene_summary: The Epilogue apologizes if the play disappointed, hoping it pleased some, especially women, for depicting virtuous figures like Katherine. It seeks applause, concluding the historical drama.
